node.title: Biden to issue executive order to explore U.S. digital dollar
node.description: He's exploring the establishment of a U.S. Central Bank Digital Currency.

node.title: National's Luxon doubles down on tax cuts
node.description: Opposition leader Christopher Luxon is continuing to flag tax cuts and government spending as two of the battleground subjects for the next election. Audio

node.title: Senior firefighter quits association over its treatment of women
node.description: A senior firefighter has left the only association for volunteers after its chief executive, who has faced sexual assault allegations from women, made a post celebrating International Women's Dayâ€¦

node.title: Venezuela frees two Americans amid talks hastened by Ukraine war
node.description: The U.S. and Venezuela were already revisiting their hostile relationship but the war -- and its resulting impact on oil and gas prices -- sped things up.

node.title: Virginia Giuffre's lawsuit against Prince Andrew dismissed
node.description: A US judge has ordered the dismissal of Virginia Giuffre's lawsuit accusing Prince Andrew of sexually abusing her, as Britain's finance ministry confirmed no public funds were used in the settlement.

node.title: Cranmer Square protesters dwindle amid deadline to leave
node.description: Protesters opposing Covid-19 vaccine mandates appear to be sticking to their word and packing up their illegal camp in a central Christchurch park.

node.title: Brutal shark treatment on fishing vessels enabled by law exemption
node.description: Forest and Bird says reports from fishing boat observers shows brutal treatment of shark by-catch.

node.title: Pike River Mine: Proof of more human remains found
node.description: A borehole drilling investigation to gather footage inside the Pike River Mine has come to an end, with images taken over the past two years showing the remains of eight men.

node.title: Top lawmakers agree on $13.6B in aid for Ukraine, European allies
node.description: The fresh funding ensured robust bipartisan support for the mammoth $1.5 trillion omnibus spending package it's part of. That package would avert a weekend election-year federal shutdown.

node.title: National calls for Faafoi to boost response to Ukraine crisis
node.description: National is accusing the Immigration Minister Kris Faafoi of sitting on his hands over the Ukraine crisis and say it's time for him to go.

node.title: Australian Prime Minister to declare floods a national emergency
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison will declare a national emergency in response to catastrophic floods in northern New South Wales.

node.title: Senior firefighter quits union over its treatment of women
node.description: A senior firefighter has left the only union for volunteers after its chief executive, who has faced sexual assault allegations from women, made a post celebrating International Women's Day yesterday.

node.title: Christchurch DHB almost at patient capacity as Covid peak approaches
node.description: Canterbury's DHB is already teetering on patient capacity, three weeks away from an expected peak of Covid-19 cases.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 22,454 new community cases, 742 in hospital, four deaths
node.description: The Ministry of Health is reporting 22,454 new community cases of Covid-19 and four further deaths today, with 742 people in hospital with the virus.

node.title: Govt should reduce isolation times further - Act
node.description: Reducing the isolation period for a positive Covid-19 case by three days is weak and comes too late, Act leader David Seymour says.

node.title: Mainzeal directors failed first step of a crisis, Supreme Court told
node.description: A lawyer for Mainzeal's liquidators says the company was in a crisis that the directors failed to recognise.

node.title: Centuria looks to raise $121m to buy 23 aged care properties
node.description: Australasian property fund manager Centuria is looking to raise $121 million to buy 23 properties offering services for rest homes with hospital and specialist care.

node.title: Building supplies report will bring incremental gains, academic says
node.description: An academic says the country's consumer watchdog is unlikely to completely shake up the residential building supplies sector.

node.title: Officer and suspect killed, two other officers hospitalized in Missouri shooting
node.description: One officer is in critical condition and the other is in serious but stable condition, police said.

node.title: Texas man guilty for role in assault on US Capitol in landmark win for prosecutors
node.description: A Texas man who joined the 6 January 2021 assault on the US Capitol by supporters of former president Donald Trump was found guilty for his role in the attack.

node.title: Wanted man who fled from police in Northland found
node.description: A man with 12 outstanding warrants for his arrest in has now been found by police.

node.title: Temel Atacocugu in hospital eight days into Walk for Peace
node.description: A survivor of the Christchurch mosque massacre, who is walking 350 kilometres from Dunedin to Christchurch, is currently in Timaru Hospital with a blood infection.

node.title: Congress passes overhaul of Postal Service
node.description: The long-fought postal overhaul has been years in the making and comes amid widespread complaints about mail service slowdowns.

node.title: 11-year-old Ukrainian flees to safety in Slovakia by himself
node.description: The boy's mother said she is a widow and explained she was unable to leave because she had to stay with her sick mother who cannot move on her own.

node.title: Sydney rainfall breaks record as flood emergency continues
node.description: Sydney is enduring its wettest start to the year since records began in 1859, and authorities are warning the state's flooding emergency is not yet over.

node.title: Father and son play pivotal roles in fate of Kimbolton meteorite
node.description: More than 40 years ago the man who found a meteorite billions of years old hit it with a sledgehammer - unaware of its significance.

node.title: Queenstown vaccination clinic to target those who received incorrectly stored doses
node.description: A pop-up, drive-through vaccination clinic will open this week in Queenstown after close to 1600 people received Covid-19 vaccines that were stored incorrectly.

node.title: Minneapolis teachers go on strike for better pay and smaller class sizes
node.description: Minneapolis Public Schools canceled all of its classes Tuesday, impacting some 29,000 students.

node.title: Jury picked for Michigan Governor Whitmer kidnapping plot trial
node.description: Prosecutors have said the defendants were angry about pandemic restrictions the Democratic governor imposed.

node.title: 'We've had it': Tinkering not enough to rein in supermarket giants, advocate says
node.description: Critics hoping for sweeping changes to the supermarket sector are unimpressed with the Commerce Commission's final recommendations. Audio
